elements.title: Sly & The Family Stone: ‘I Gotta Go Now (Up On The Floor) / Funky Broadway’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
elements.contents:
Sly & The Family Stone: ‘I Gotta Go Now (Up On The Floor) / Funky Broadway’

 Best New Music

Sly & The Family Stone ’s earliest days as a live band are finally on the record via today’s release of The First Family: Live at Winchester Cathedral 1967.

Jul. 25

elements.title: The Beths: ‘Metal’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
elements.contents:
The Beths: ‘Metal’

 Best New Music

New Zealanders The Beths have a bouncy, ‘90s-esque-jangle-rock sound that keeps us feeling forever young.

Jul. 24

elements.title: ELESTELA: ‘Bounce Back’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
elements.contents:
ELESTELA: ‘Bounce Back’

 Best New Music

Elvin Estela is a hero of the LA underground. Most notably as a co-founder of the taste-making club night Low End Theory, and producing boundary-expanding beats as Nobody.

Jul. 23

elements.title: Funkadelic: ‘I Bet You’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
elements.contents:
Funkadelic: ‘I Bet You’

 Best New Music

Today we celebrate the long-awaited vinyl reissue of Funkadelic ’s 1970 debut.

Jul. 22

elements.title: Disinblud: ‘Give-Upping’ (feat. Julianna Barwick) (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
elements.contents:
Disinblud: ‘Give-Upping’ (feat. Julianna Barwick)

 Best New Music

Composers and multi-instrumentalists Rachika Nayar & Nina Keith are combining their powers as Disinblud .

Jul. 21

elements.title: Leroi Conroy: ‘Panthera Cry’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
elements.contents:
Leroi Conroy: ‘Panthera Cry’

 Best New Music

Leroi Conroy is the alter-ego of Colemine Records’ owner, recording artist, and sound designer Terry Cole.

Jul. 18

elements.title: Marissa Nadler: ‘New Radiations’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
elements.contents:
Marissa Nadler: ‘New Radiations’

 Best New Music

Consummate collaborator Marissa Nadler (Father John Misty, John Cale, Angel Olsen, etc.) will release her tenth studio album New Radiations on Aug. 15 via Sacred Bones Records.

Jul. 17

elements.title: 54 Ultra: ‘No Tengo Valor’ (KCRW Todays Top Tune)
elements.contents:
54 Ultra: ‘No Tengo Valor’

 Best New Music

New Jersey-based synth-rock-soul purveyor 54 Ultra slays us with First Work, a six-track EP that contains the Spanglish single “No Tengo Valor.”

Jul. 16
